oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Efficiency of Converting Nutrient Dry Matter to Milk in Holstein Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Britt, J. S.
Thomas, R. C.
Speer, N. C.
Hall, M. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: milk production
dry matter intake
feed efficiency
factors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Production of milk from feed dry matter intake (DMI), called dairy or feed efficiency, is not commonly measured in dairy herds as is feed conversion to weight gain in swine, beef and poultry; however, it has relevance to conversion of purchased input to saleable product and proportion of dietary nutrients excreted. The purpose of this study was to identify some readily measured factors that affect dairy efficiency.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2004; 178
